New Records: Liam Scales scored his first goal for his country
Key Match Events: Finland scored the first goal of the match in the 17th minute after Nathan Collins mishit a back-pass to Caoimhín Kelleher under no pressure
Ireland's Evan Ferguson had a disallowed goal in the 21st minute due to Collins being offside
Ireland equalized in the 57th minute with Liam Scales' header from Robbie Brady's free-kick
Ireland took the lead in the 88th minute with Robbie Brady's goal after Festy Ebosele's cross
Ireland secured a 2-1 victory over Finland in the end
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland team manager Heimir Halgrímsson sought his first win in charge
Evan Ferguson returned to lead the line for Ireland
Finn Azaz made his competitive debut for the Republic of Ireland
Ireland had a few changes to the starting XI that lost 2-0 to Greece last month
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland came from behind to earn three points in Helsinki
Heimir Halgrímsson finally got his first win in charge
Ireland secured a 2-1 victory over Finland
Miscellaneous Highlights: There were only 15-odd-thousand tickets sold for the match at a 36,000-capacity stadium
The Finns were even less optimistic about their national team than the Irish public were about their own team
The match was a relegation scrap for both sides
Others: The game was described as 'bad' by the liveblogger, with Finland and Ireland both being 'bad' in their own ways
Ireland's Evan Ferguson was described as'sharper' in the second half than he was in the first
